title.raw: 《項羽本紀》 Annals of Xiang Yu

sentences.zh: 項籍者，下相人也，字羽。

translations.literal: Xiang Ji was a man from Xiaxiang, styled Yu.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Ji came from the town of Xiaxiang and was styled Yu.

sentences.zh: 初起時，年二十四。

translations.literal: When he first rose up, he was twenty-four years old.
translations.idiomatic: When he first took up arms, he was twenty-four years old.

sentences.zh: 其季父項梁，梁父即楚將項燕，為秦將王翦所戮者也。

translations.literal: His youngest uncle Xiang Liang; Liang's father was precisely the Chu general Xiang Yan, who was executed by the Qin general Wang Jian.
translations.idiomatic: His uncle Xiang Liang was the son of the Chu general Xiang Yan, who had been executed by the Qin general Wang Jian.

sentences.zh: 項氏世世為楚將，封於項，故姓項氏。

translations.literal: The Xiang clan generation after generation served as Chu generals, were enfeoffed at Xiang, therefore took the surname Xiang.
translations.idiomatic: The Xiang family had served as generals for the state of Chu for generations. They were enfeoffed at Xiang, hence took the surname Xiang.

translations.literal: Xiang Ji was a Xiaxiang native, styled Yu. When he first rose up, he was twenty-four years old. His youngest uncle was Xiang Liang. Liang's father was the Chu general Xiang Yan, who was beheaded by the Qin general Wang Jian. The Xiang clan generation after generation were Chu generals, enfeoffed at Xiang, therefore they took the surname Xiang.

sentences.zh: 項籍少時，學書不成，去學劍，又不成。

translations.literal: When Xiang Ji was young, he studied writing but didn't succeed, then went to study swordsmanship, and again didn't succeed.
translations.idiomatic: In his youth, Xiang Ji tried to learn calligraphy but failed. He then tried swordsmanship but failed at that too.

sentences.zh: 項梁怒之。

translations.literal: Xiang Liang was angry with him.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang grew angry with him.

sentences.zh: 籍曰：「書足以記名姓而已。

translations.literal: Ji said: 'Writing is sufficient only to record names and surnames.
translations.idiomatic: Ji replied, 'Writing is only good for recording names and surnames.

sentences.zh: 劍一人敵，不足學，學萬人敵。」

translations.literal: A sword fights one person, not worth learning; learn to fight ten thousand people.'
translations.idiomatic: A sword is for fighting one man—not worth studying. Learn to command armies of ten thousand.'

sentences.zh: 於是項梁乃教籍兵法，籍大喜，略知其意，又不肯竟學。

translations.literal: Thereupon Xiang Liang taught Ji military strategy. Ji was greatly pleased, understood its general principles, but again refused to study it completely.
translations.idiomatic: So Xiang Liang taught him the art of war. Xiang Ji was delighted and grasped the basic concepts, but refused to complete his studies.

sentences.zh: 項梁嘗有櫟陽逮，乃請蘄獄掾曹咎書抵櫟陽獄掾司馬欣，以故事得已。

translations.literal: Xiang Liang once had a Queyang arrest case, so he requested the Qi prison clerk Cao Jiu to write a letter to the Queyang prison clerk Sima Xin, and through precedents got it resolved.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang once faced arrest in Queyang. He asked the prison official Cao Jiu from Qi to write to the prison official Sima Xin in Queyang, and through legal precedents the matter was resolved.

sentences.zh: 項梁殺人，與籍避仇於吳中。

translations.literal: Xiang Liang killed someone, and together with Ji fled their enemies to Wu region.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang had killed a man, so he and Xiang Ji fled to the Wu region to escape their enemies.

sentences.zh: 吳中賢士大夫皆出項梁下。

translations.literal: The worthy scholars and officials in Wu all served under Xiang Liang.
translations.idiomatic: All the worthy gentlemen and officials in the Wu region acknowledged Xiang Liang as their leader.

sentences.zh: 每吳中有大繇役及喪，項梁常為主辦，陰以兵法部勒賓客及子弟，以是知其能。

translations.literal: Whenever there were great labor services or funerals in Wu, Xiang Liang always took charge of organizing them, secretly using military methods to organize the guests and younger relatives, and through this people knew his abilities.
translations.idiomatic: Whenever the Wu region had major labor projects or funerals, Xiang Liang always took charge. Secretly he organized the guests and young men using military discipline, and through this people recognized his capabilities.

sentences.zh: 秦始皇帝游會稽，渡浙江，梁與籍俱觀。

translations.literal: When the First Emperor of Qin toured Kuaiji and crossed the Zhejiang, Liang and Ji both watched.
translations.idiomatic: When Qin Shi Huang toured Kuaiji and crossed the Zhejiang River, both Xiang Liang and Xiang Ji watched from the crowd.

sentences.zh: 籍曰：「彼可取而代也。」

translations.literal: Ji said: 'He can be taken and replaced.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Ji said, 'That man can be seized and replaced.'

sentences.zh: 梁掩其口，曰：「毋妄言，族矣！」

translations.literal: Liang covered his mouth, saying: 'Don't speak recklessly, you'll destroy the whole clan!'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang clapped his hand over Xiang Ji's mouth. 'Don't talk nonsense,' he said. 'You'll get our whole clan executed!'

sentences.zh: 梁以此奇籍。

translations.literal: Liang considered Ji extraordinary because of this.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang regarded Xiang Ji as extraordinary because of this incident.

sentences.zh: 籍長八尺餘，力能扛鼎，才氣過人，雖吳中子弟皆已憚籍矣。

translations.literal: Ji was over eight chi tall, had the strength to lift tripods, and his talent and spirit surpassed others. Even the young men of Wu already feared Ji.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Ji stood over eight feet tall and had the strength to lift a bronze tripod. His talent and spirit were extraordinary. Even the young men of Wu feared him.

translations.literal: When Xiang Ji was young, he studied writing but did not succeed. He left to study swordsmanship, but again did not succeed. Xiang Liang was angry with him. Ji said: 'Writing is sufficient only to record names and surnames. Swordsmanship fights one person enemy, not sufficient to learn. Learn to fight ten thousand people enemy.' Thereupon Xiang Liang taught Ji military methods. Ji was greatly happy, roughly knew its meaning, but moreover was not willing to completely learn. Xiang Liang once had a Queyang arrest warrant. He then requested the Qi prison clerk Cao Jiu to write a letter reaching the Queyang prison clerk Sima Xin, and with former matters obtained an end to it. Xiang Liang killed a person and with Ji avoided enemies in Wuzhong. All the worthy scholars and grand masters in Wuzhong came out below Xiang Liang. Whenever Wuzhong had great labor service or mourning, Xiang Liang was constantly the main manager. Secretly he organized the guests and younger brothers with military methods. With this they knew his ability. The Qin Beginning Emperor toured Kuiji and crossed the Zhejiang. Liang and Ji together observed. Ji said: 'That can be taken and replaced.' Liang covered his mouth, saying: 'Do not speak recklessly, the clan will perish!' Liang considered Ji extraordinary with this. Ji was tall over eight chi, had strength to lift a tripod, talent and spirit surpassed people. Though the younger brothers in Wuzhong all already feared Ji.

sentences.zh: 秦二世元年七月，陳涉等起大澤中。

translations.literal: In the first year of Qin Ershi, seventh month, Chen She and others rose up in Daze.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh month of the first year of Qin Ershi's reign, Chen She and others rose in rebellion from the Great Swamp.

sentences.zh: 其九月，會稽守通謂梁曰：「江西皆反，此亦天亡秦之時也。

translations.literal: In the ninth month, the Kuaiji governor Tong said to Liang: 'West of the Jiang are all rebelling, this is also the time when Heaven intends to destroy Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month, the governor of Kuaiji, Yin Tong, said to Xiang Liang, 'Everyone west of the Yangtze has rebelled. This is Heaven's time to destroy Qin.'

sentences.zh: 吾聞先即制人，後則為人所制。

translations.literal: I have heard that he who strikes first controls others, he who strikes later is controlled by others.
translations.idiomatic: I've heard it said that those who strike first control others, while those who strike later are controlled.

sentences.zh: 吾欲發兵，使公及桓楚將。」

translations.literal: I wish to raise troops, and have you and Huan Chu command them.'
translations.idiomatic: I intend to raise an army and put you and Huan Chu in command.'

sentences.zh: 是時桓楚亡在澤中。

translations.literal: At this time Huan Chu was hiding in the marshes.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Huan Chu was in hiding in the marshes.

sentences.zh: 梁曰：「桓楚亡，人莫知其處，獨籍知之耳。」

translations.literal: Liang said: 'Huan Chu is in hiding, no one knows his location, only Ji knows it.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang replied, 'Huan Chu is in hiding. No one knows where he is—only Xiang Ji does.'

sentences.zh: 梁乃出，誡籍持劍居外待。

translations.literal: Liang then went out and instructed Ji to hold his sword and wait outside.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang stepped out and told Xiang Ji to stand guard outside with his sword drawn.

sentences.zh: 梁復入，與守坐，曰：「請召籍，使受命召桓楚。」

translations.literal: Liang entered again, sat with the governor, and said: 'Please summon Ji so he can receive orders to summon Huan Chu.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang returned inside and sat with the governor. 'Please summon Xiang Ji,' he said, 'so he can receive orders to call up Huan Chu.'

sentences.zh: 守曰：「諾。」

translations.literal: The governor said: "Very well."
translations.idiomatic: The governor agreed.

sentences.zh: 梁召籍入。

translations.literal: Liang summoned Ji to enter.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang called Xiang Ji inside.

sentences.zh: 須臾，梁眴籍曰：「可行矣！」

translations.literal: After a moment, Liang winked at Ji and said: "You may proceed!"
translations.idiomatic: A moment later, Xiang Liang winked at Xiang Ji and said, "Do it!"

sentences.zh: 於是籍遂拔劍斬守頭。

translations.literal: Thereupon Ji drew his sword and cut off the governor's head.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Ji then drew his sword and beheaded the governor.

sentences.zh: 項梁持守頭，佩其印綬。

translations.literal: Xiang Liang held the governor's head and wore his seal cord.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang took the governor's head and put on his official seal.

sentences.zh: 門下大驚，擾亂，籍所擊殺數十百人。

translations.literal: The gate guards were greatly alarmed, Ji struck and killed several dozen people.
translations.idiomatic: The guards at the gate were terrified. Xiang Ji struck down dozens of them.

sentences.zh: 一府中皆慴伏，莫敢起。

translations.literal: Everyone in the headquarters was terrified and submissive, no one dared rise.
translations.idiomatic: Everyone in the headquarters was cowed into submission. No one dared to resist.

sentences.zh: 梁乃召故所知豪吏，諭以所為起大事，遂舉吳中兵。

translations.literal: Liang then summoned the influential officials he had known before, and explained to them the great undertaking they were starting.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang summoned the powerful officials he knew and explained the great rebellion they were launching.

sentences.zh: 使人收下縣，得精兵八千人。

translations.literal: They then raised troops from Wu region, and sent people to gather from the subordinate counties, obtaining eight thousand elite soldiers.
translations.idiomatic: They raised an army from the Wu region and sent recruiters to the neighboring counties, gathering eight thousand crack troops.

sentences.zh: 梁部署吳中豪傑為校尉、候、司馬。

translations.literal: Liang appointed the heroic figures of Wu as colonels, scouts, and adjutants.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang appointed the leading men of Wu as officers—colonels, scouts, and adjutants.

sentences.zh: 有一人不得用，自言於梁。

translations.literal: There was one person who did not get an official position, and spoke to Liang about it himself.
translations.idiomatic: One man who didn't receive an appointment complained directly to Xiang Liang.

sentences.zh: 梁曰：「前時某喪使公主某事，不能辦，以此不任用公。」

translations.literal: Liang said: "At such-and-such a time, for such-and-such a matter, I sent Merchant So-and-so, and he got heavy bribes, so I had no choice but to give him the position."
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang replied, "At a certain time, for a certain matter, I sent Merchant X on business. He received heavy bribes, so I had to give him the appointment."

sentences.zh: 眾乃皆伏。

translations.literal: Thereupon Ji cut off the merchant's head to make an example, saying: "You all follow the army: the first to arrive become generals, next become adjutants, later ones become soldiers, those who wish to leave may do so."
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Ji then beheaded the merchant as an example. "All of you join the army," he announced. "First to arrive become generals, next become adjutants, last become common soldiers. Those who wish to leave may go."

sentences.zh: 於是梁為會稽守，籍為裨將，徇下縣。

translations.literal: Thereupon those who wished to leave firmly stayed, those who wished to stay left.
translations.idiomatic: Those who wanted to leave stayed put, while those who wanted to stay departed.

translations.literal: In Qin Second Generation's first year, seventh month, Chen She and others rose up in the great marsh. In the ninth month, the Kuiji governor Tong said to Liang: 'West of the Jiang all rebelled. This is also the time when heaven perishes Qin. I have heard: first then control people, later then be controlled by people. I wish to dispatch troops, make you and Huan Chu generals.' At this time, Huan Chu had fled in the marsh. Liang said: 'Huan Chu has fled. No one knows his place. Only Ji knows it.' Liang then went out and warned Ji to hold his sword and wait outside. Liang again entered and sat with the governor, saying: 'Please summon Ji to make him receive the command to summon Huan Chu.' The governor said: 'Agreed.' Liang summoned Ji to enter. In a moment, Liang winked at Ji, saying: 'Can act already!' Thereupon Ji drew his sword and beheaded the governor. Xiang Liang held the governor's head and wore his seal ribbons. Those below the gate were greatly startled and disturbed. Ji struck and killed several tens of people. Everyone in the office was terrified and submitted. None dared rise. Liang then summoned the heroic officials he formerly knew, explained what they were doing to raise great matters, and raised the Wuzhong troops. He had people collect from the lower counties and obtained eight thousand elite troops. Liang deployed the heroic outstanding men of Wuzhong as company commanders, scouts, and adjutants. There was one person who did not obtain use. He spoke to Liang himself. Liang said: 'In former times, a certain mourning made you duke handle certain matters. You could not manage them. With this I did not employ you.' The crowd then all submitted. Thereupon Liang became the Kuiji governor, Ji became assistant general, and toured the lower counties.

sentences.zh: 廣陵人召平於是為陳王徇廣陵，未能下。

translations.literal: Ji said: "What sort of person is a stalwart warrior?"
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Ji asked, "What kind of man is a true warrior?"

sentences.zh: 聞陳王敗走，秦兵又且至，乃渡江矯陳王命，拜梁為楚王上柱國。

translations.literal: He stripped off his clothes and asked to be tattooed where the sword had struck.
translations.idiomatic: He bared his body and asked to be tattooed at the spot where the sword had cut him.

sentences.zh: 曰：「江東已定，急引兵西擊秦。」

translations.literal: They tattooed him.
translations.idiomatic: They tattooed him.

sentences.zh: 項梁乃以八千人渡江而西。

translations.literal: At this time, in all the commanderies and counties that suffered under Qin officials, they all punished their chief officials and killed them to respond to Chen She.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, in all the commanderies and counties that suffered under Qin rule, the people executed their local officials to join Chen She's rebellion.

sentences.zh: 聞陳嬰已下東陽，使使欲與連和俱西。

translations.literal: They then made Liang governor of Kuaiji, and Ji assistant general.
translations.idiomatic: They appointed Xiang Liang as governor of Kuaiji and Xiang Ji as his deputy general.

sentences.zh: 陳嬰者，故東陽令史，居縣中，素信謹，稱為長者。

translations.literal: They toured the subordinate counties.
translations.idiomatic: They marched through the neighboring counties.

sentences.zh: 東陽少年殺其令，相聚數千人，欲置長，無適用，乃請陳嬰。

translations.literal: The Guangling man Zhao Ping was then campaigning for the King of Chen at Guangling, but could not conquer it.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Ping of Guangling was at this time campaigning for the King of Chen at Guangling, but failed to take it.

sentences.zh: 嬰謝不能，遂彊立嬰為長，縣中從者得二萬人。

translations.literal: Liang sent Ji to attack Guangling, and he broke it.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang sent Xiang Ji to attack Guangling, and he captured it.

sentences.zh: 少年欲立嬰便為王，異軍蒼頭特起。

translations.literal: He returned and reported to Liang, who was greatly pleased and entrusted all military affairs to Ji.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Ji returned and reported to Xiang Liang, who was delighted and put Xiang Ji in charge of all military operations.

sentences.zh: 陳嬰母謂嬰曰：「自我為汝家婦，未嘗聞汝先古之有貴者。

translations.literal: Ji then led troops to attack Yuanfu.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Ji then led his troops to attack Yuanfu.

sentences.zh: 今暴得大名，不祥。
不如有所屬，事成猶得封侯，事敗易以亡，非世所指名也。」
嬰乃不敢為王。
謂其軍吏曰：「項氏世世將家，有名於楚。
今欲舉大事，將非其人，不可。
我倚名族，亡秦必矣。」
於是眾從其言，以兵屬項梁。
項梁渡淮，黥布、蒲將軍亦以兵屬焉。
凡六七萬人，軍下邳。

translations.literal: The Guangling person Zhao Ping at this time toured Guangling for the Chen king, but was not yet able to submit it. He heard the Chen king was defeated and fled, Qin troops moreover were about to arrive. He then crossed the Jiang, forged the Chen king's command, and appointed Liang as Chu king supreme pillar of state. He said: 'Jiang east is already settled. Urgently lead troops west to strike Qin.' Xiang Liang then with eight thousand people crossed the Jiang westward. He heard Chen Ying had already submitted Dongyang. He sent an envoy wishing to connect in harmony and go west together. Chen Ying was a former Dongyang magistrate's secretary. He resided in the county, was originally trustworthy and careful, called an elder. The Dongyang youths killed their magistrate, mutually gathered several thousand people. They wished to establish a leader. None was suitable. They then requested Chen Ying. Ying declined he could not. They then strongly established Ying as leader. The county followers obtained twenty thousand people. The youths wished to establish Ying directly as king, with different army dark heads specially rising. Chen Ying's mother said to Ying: 'Since I became your family's woman, I have never heard that your ancestors had noble ones. Now you have suddenly obtained a great name. This is not auspicious. It is not as good as having a belonging. If matters succeed, you can still obtain enfeoffment as marquis. If matters fail, it is easy to flee. You will not be what the world points to by name.' Ying then did not dare to be king. He said to his army officials: 'The Xiang clan is generation after generation a general's family, has name in Chu. Now we wish to raise great matters. If the general is not the right person, it is not possible. I rely on the famous clan. Perishing Qin is certain.' Thereupon the crowd followed his words and attached their troops to Xiang Liang. Xiang Liang crossed the Huai. Qing Bu and General Pu also attached their troops there. Altogether sixty to seventy thousand people, stationed at Xiapi.

sentences.zh: 當是時，秦嘉已立景駒為楚王，軍彭城東，欲距項梁。
項梁謂軍吏曰：「陳王先首事，戰不利，未聞所在。
今秦嘉倍陳王而立景駒，逆無道。」
乃進兵擊秦嘉。
秦嘉軍敗走，追之至胡陵。
嘉還戰一日，嘉死，軍降。
景駒走死梁地。
項梁已并秦嘉軍，軍胡陵，將引軍而西。
章邯軍至栗，項梁使別將朱雞石、餘樊君與戰。
餘樊君死。
朱雞石軍敗，亡走胡陵。
項梁乃引兵入薛，誅雞石。
項梁前使項羽別攻襄城，襄城堅守不下。
已拔，皆阬之。
還報項梁。
項梁聞陳王定死，召諸別將會薛計事。
此時沛公亦起沛，往焉。

translations.literal: At this time, Qin Jia had already established Jing Ju as Chu king, stationed east of Pengcheng, wishing to resist Xiang Liang. Xiang Liang said to the army officials: 'The Chen king first began the matters. The battle was unfavorable. We have not heard his location. Now Qin Jia has rebelled against the Chen king and established Jing Ju. This is perverse and without way.' He then advanced troops to strike Qin Jia. Qin Jia's army was defeated and fled. They pursued him to Huling. Jia returned and battled for one day. Jia died. The army surrendered. Jing Ju fled and died in Liang territory. Xiang Liang had already united with Qin Jia's army, stationed at Huling, and would lead the army westward. Zhang Han's army arrived at Li. Xiang Liang had separate generals Zhu Jishi and Yu Fanjun battle them. Yu Fanjun died. Zhu Jishi's army was defeated and fled to Huling. Xiang Liang then led troops into Xue and executed Jishi. Xiang Liang had previously made Xiang Yu separately attack Xiangcheng. Xiangcheng firmly guarded and did not submit. When it was already captured, he pitted them all. He returned and reported to Xiang Liang. Xiang Liang heard the Chen king had certainly died. He summoned the various separate generals to assemble at Xue and plan matters. At this time, Pei Gong also rose at Pei and went there.

sentences.zh: 居鄛人范增，年七十，素居家，好奇計，往說項梁曰：「陳勝敗碧當。
夫秦滅六國，楚最無罪。
自懷王入秦不反，楚人憐之至今，故楚南公曰『楚雖三戶，亡秦必楚』也。
今陳勝首事，不立楚後而自立，其勢不長。
今君起江東，楚蜂午之將皆爭附君者，以君世世楚將，為能復立楚之後也。」
於是項梁然其言，乃求楚懷王孫心民閒，為人牧羊，立以為楚懷王，從民所望也。
陳嬰為楚上柱國，封五縣，與懷王都盱臺。
項梁自號為武信君。

translations.literal: The Juju person Fan Zeng, age seventy, originally resided at home and liked strange plans. He went to persuade Xiang Liang, saying: 'Chen Sheng's defeat should. Qin extinguished the six states. Chu was most without crime. Since King Huai entered Qin and did not return, the Chu people have pitied him until now. Therefore Chu Nangong said 'Though Chu has only three households, perishing Qin will certainly be Chu.' Now Chen Sheng first began the matters but did not establish Chu descendants and self-established. His situation will not be long. Now you, my lord, rose in Jiangdong. All the Chu generals like swarming bees contend to attach to you, because you are generation after generation Chu generals, able to again establish Chu descendants.' Thereupon Xiang Liang approved his words. He then sought Chu King Huai's grandson Xin among the people. He was a person herding sheep. He established him as Chu King Huai, following what the people hoped. Chen Ying became Chu supreme pillar of state, enfeoffed five counties, and with King Huai made the capital Xutai. Xiang Liang self-titled as Lord Martial Faith.

sentences.zh: 居數月，引兵攻亢父，與齊田榮、司馬龍且軍救東阿，大破秦軍於東阿。
田榮即引兵歸，逐其王假。
假亡走楚。
假相田角亡走趙。
角弟田閒故齊將，居趙不敢歸。
田榮立田儋子市為齊王。
項梁已破東阿下軍，遂追秦軍。
數使使趣齊兵，欲與俱西。
田榮曰：「楚殺田假，趙殺田角、田閒，乃發兵。」
項梁曰：「田假為與國之王，窮來從我，不忍殺之。」
趙亦不殺田角、田閒以市於齊。
齊遂不肯發兵助楚。
項梁使沛公及項羽別攻城陽，屠之。
西破秦軍濮陽東，秦兵收入濮陽。
沛公、項羽乃攻定陶。
定陶未下，去，西略地至雝丘，大破秦軍，斬李由。
還攻外黃，外黃未下。

translations.literal: He resided several months, led troops to attack Kangfu, and with Qi's Tian Rong and Sima Longju's army rescued Dong'e. They greatly broke the Qin army at Dong'e. Tian Rong immediately led troops back and expelled their king Jia. Jia fled to Chu. Jia's chancellor Tian Jiao fled to Zhao. Jiao's younger brother Tian Jian was a former Qi general. He resided in Zhao and did not dare return. Tian Rong established Tian Dan's son Shi as Qi king. Xiang Liang, having already defeated the Dong'e garrison, then pursued the Qin army. He repeatedly sent envoys to urge Qi troops, wishing to advance west together with them. Tian Rong said: 'Chu killed Tian Jia, Zhao killed Tian Jiao and Tian Jian. Only then will we send troops.' Xiang Liang said: 'Tian Jia was king of an allied state. He came to me destitute and loyal. I cannot bear to kill him.' Zhao also spared Tian Jiao and Tian Jian to use as bargaining chips with Qi. Qi then refused to send troops to help Chu. Xiang Liang sent Liu Bang and Xiang Yu to separately attack Chengyang and put it to the slaughter. To the west, they defeated the Qin army east of Puyang. The Qin troops withdrew into Puyang. Liu Bang and Xiang Yu then attacked Dingtao. Dingtao did not fall. They left and raided west to Yongqiu, where they greatly defeated the Qin army and beheaded Li You. They returned to attack Waihuang, but Waihuang did not fall.

sentences.zh: 項梁起東阿，西，（北）［比］至定陶，再破秦軍，項羽等又斬李由，益輕秦，有驕色。
宋義乃諫項梁曰：「戰勝而將驕卒惰者敗。
今卒少惰矣，秦兵日益，臣為君畏之。」
項梁弗聽。
乃使宋義使於齊。
道遇齊使者高陵君顯，曰：「公將見武信君乎？」
曰：「臣論武信君軍必敗。
公徐行即免死，疾行則及禍。」
秦果悉起兵益章邯，擊楚軍，大破之定陶，項梁死。
沛公、項羽去外黃攻陳留，陳留堅守不能下。
沛公、項羽相與謀曰：「今項梁軍破，士卒恐。」
乃與呂臣軍俱引兵而東。
呂臣軍彭城東，項羽軍彭城西，沛公軍碭。

translations.literal: Xiang Liang rose from Dong'e, went west, and reached Dingtao. He again defeated the Qin army. Xiang Yu and others again beheaded Li You. He increasingly despised Qin and showed an arrogant demeanor. Song Yi then admonished Xiang Liang, saying: 'Generals who grow arrogant and troops who grow lazy after victory are doomed to defeat. Our troops are already growing lazy. Qin's forces are increasing daily. Your minister fears this for you.' Xiang Liang did not listen. He then sent Song Yi as an envoy to Qi. On the road, he met the Qi envoy Lord Gaoling Xian, who said: 'Sir, are you going to see Lord Wuxin?' He said: 'Yes.' He said: 'In my minister's view, Lord Wuxin's army is certain to be defeated. If you travel slowly, sir, you will avoid death. If you travel quickly, you will meet with calamity.' Qin indeed mobilized all their troops to reinforce Zhang Han. They struck the Chu army and greatly defeated it at Dingtao. Xiang Liang died. Liu Bang and Xiang Yu left Waihuang to attack Chenliu, but Chenliu defended firmly and could not be taken. Liu Bang and Xiang Yu conferred together and said: 'Now Xiang Liang's army has been broken. The soldiers are terrified.' They then led their troops east together with Lü Chen's army. Lü Chen's army was east of Pengcheng, Xiang Yu's army west of Pengcheng, Liu Bang's army at Dang.

sentences.zh: 章邯已破項梁軍，則以為楚地兵不足憂，乃渡河擊趙，大破之。
當此時，趙歇為王，陳餘為將，張耳為相，皆走入鉅鹿城。
章邯令王離、涉閒圍鉅鹿，章邯軍其南，筑甬道而輸之粟。
陳餘為將，將卒數萬人而軍鉅鹿之北，此所謂河北之軍也。

translations.literal: Zhang Han, having already defeated Xiang Liang's army, then considered Chu's troops no longer worth worrying about. He crossed the river to strike Zhao and greatly defeated them. At this time, Zhao Xie was king, Chen Yu was general, Zhang Er was chancellor. They all fled into Julu city. Zhang Han ordered Wang Li and She Jian to surround Julu. Zhang Han's army was to the south. He built a covered walkway to transport grain to them. Chen Yu was the general, leading tens of thousands of troops stationed north of Julu. This was the so-called Army North of the River.

sentences.zh: 楚兵已破於定陶，懷王恐，從盱臺之彭城，并項羽、呂臣軍自將之。
以呂臣為司徒，以其父呂青為令尹。
以沛公為碭郡長，封為武安侯，將碭郡兵。

translations.literal: Chu's troops had already been defeated at Dingtao. King Huai grew fearful. He moved from Xutai to Pengcheng and personally took command of Xiang Yu and Lü Chen's combined armies. He appointed Lü Chen as Minister of Justice and his father Lü Qing as Prime Minister. He appointed Liu Bang as governor of Dang commandery, enfeoffed him as Marquis of Wuan, and put him in command of Dang commandery's troops.

sentences.zh: 初，宋義所遇齊使者高陵君顯在楚軍，見楚王曰：「宋義論武信君之軍必敗，居數日，軍果敗。
兵未戰而先見敗徵，此可謂知兵矣。」
王召宋義與計事而大說之，因置以為上將軍，項羽為魯公，為次將，范增為末將，救趙。
諸別將皆屬宋義，號為卿子冠軍。
行至安陽，留四十六日不進。
項羽曰：「吾聞秦軍圍趙王鉅鹿，疾引兵渡河，楚擊其外，趙應其內，破秦軍必矣。」
宋義曰：「不然。
夫搏牛之虻不可以破蟣虱。
今秦攻趙，戰勝則兵罷，我承其敝；
不勝，則我引兵鼓行而西，必舉秦矣。
故不如先鬬秦趙。
夫被堅執銳，義不如公；
坐而運策，公不如義。」
因下令軍中曰：「猛如虎，很如羊，貪如狼，彊不可使者，皆斬之。」
乃遣其子宋襄相齊，身送之至無鹽，飲酒高會。
天寒大雨，士卒凍饑。
項羽曰：「將戮力而攻秦，久留不行。
今歲饑民貧，士卒食芋菽，軍無見糧，乃飲酒高會，不引兵渡河因趙食，與趙并力攻秦，乃曰『承其敝』。
夫以秦之彊，攻新造之趙，其勢必舉趙。
趙舉而秦彊，何敝之承！
且國兵新破，王坐不安席，埽境內而專屬於將軍，國家安危，在此一舉。
今不恤士卒而徇其私，非社稷之臣。」
項羽晨朝上將軍宋義，即其帳中斬宋義頭，出令軍中曰：「宋義與齊謀反楚，楚王陰令羽誅之。」
當是時，諸將皆慴服，莫敢枝梧。
皆曰：「首立楚者，將軍家也。
今將軍誅亂。」
乃相與共立羽為假上將軍。
使人追宋義子，及之齊，殺之。
使桓楚報命於懷王。
懷王因使項羽為上將軍，當陽君、蒲將軍皆屬項羽。

translations.literal: Initially, the Qi envoy Lord Gaoling Xian whom Song Yi had encountered was in the Chu army. He saw the Chu king and said: 'Song Yi predicted that Lord Wuxin's army would certainly be defeated. Several days later, the army was indeed defeated. He foresaw the signs of defeat before the troops even fought. This can be called true knowledge of warfare.' The king summoned Song Yi to discuss matters and was greatly pleased with him. Therefore he appointed him as supreme general, Xiang Yu as Duke of Lu and deputy general, Fan Zeng as rear general, to rescue Zhao. All the other generals were subordinated to Song Yi, who was titled Champion Marquis. They marched to Anyang but stayed there forty-six days without advancing. Xiang Yu said: 'I hear that Qin's army is surrounding King Zhao at Julu. We should quickly lead our troops across the river. Chu will strike from the outside, Zhao will respond from the inside. Breaking Qin's army is certain.' Song Yi said: 'Not so. One cannot defeat lice and ticks by fighting horseflies on an ox. Now Qin is attacking Zhao. If they win, their troops will be weary. We can inherit their exhaustion; If they don't win, then we lead our troops beating drums westward and will certainly take Qin. Therefore it is better to first let Qin and Zhao fight each other. When it comes to wearing armor and wielding sharp weapons, I am not as good as you; But when it comes to sitting and directing strategy, you are not as good as I.' Therefore he issued an order in the army saying: 'Those fierce as tigers, stubborn as sheep, greedy as wolves, who are strong but cannot be used—all shall be beheaded.' He then sent his son Song Xiang as prime minister of Qi. He personally escorted him to Wuyan and held grand drinking parties. The weather was bitterly cold with heavy rain. The soldiers were freezing and starving. Xiang Yu said: 'We are supposed to unite our strength to attack Qin, but we stay here for a long time without moving. This year brings famine and poverty to the people. Our soldiers eat only taros and beans. The army has no visible stores of grain. Yet he drinks wine and holds grand gatherings. He doesn't lead troops across the river to rely on Zhao's food supplies and combine forces with Zhao to attack Qin. Instead he says 'inherit their fatigue'. Given Qin's strength attacking the newly established Zhao, their momentum will certainly take Zhao. If Zhao falls and Qin remains strong, what fatigue will there be to inherit! Moreover, our state's troops have been newly broken. The king cannot sit at ease. He has swept the entire realm and placed it exclusively under the general. The state's safety or danger rests on this one action. Now he does not pity the soldiers but follows his private interests. He is not a minister of the state altars.' Xiang Yu went to the morning audience with Supreme General Song Yi, and immediately in his tent beheaded Song Yi. He issued an order in the army saying: 'Song Yi conspired with Qi to rebel against Chu. The Chu king secretly ordered me to execute him.' At this time, all the generals trembled and submitted. None dared to oppose. They all said: 'The ones who first established Chu were the general's family. Now the general has executed the rebel.' They then mutually agreed to establish Yu as acting supreme general. They sent people to pursue Song Yi's son. They caught up with him in Qi and killed him. They sent Huan Chu to report the command to King Huai. King Huai therefore made Xiang Yu supreme general. Lord Dangyang and General Pu all came under Xiang Yu.

sentences.zh: 項羽已殺卿子冠軍，威震楚國，名聞諸侯。
乃遣當陽君、蒲將軍將卒二萬渡河，救鉅鹿。
戰少利，陳餘復請兵。
項羽乃悉引兵渡河，皆沈船，破釜甑，燒廬舍，持三日糧，以示士卒必死，無一還心。
於是至則圍王離，與秦軍遇，九戰，絕其甬道，大破之，殺蘇角，虜王離。
涉閒不降楚，自燒殺。
當是時，楚兵冠諸侯。
諸侯軍救鉅鹿下者十餘壁，莫敢縱兵。
及楚擊秦，諸將皆從壁上觀。
楚戰士無不一以當十，楚兵呼聲動天，諸侯軍無不人人惴恐。
於是已破秦軍，項羽召見諸侯將，入轅門，無不膝行而前，莫敢仰視。
項羽由是始為諸侯上將軍，諸侯皆屬焉。

translations.literal: Xiang Yu had already killed the Champion Marquis. His awe shook the Chu state. His name was heard among the feudal lords. He then sent Lord Dangyang and General Pu leading twenty thousand troops to cross the river and rescue Julu. They fought with little advantage. Chen Yu again requested troops. Xiang Yu then led all his troops across the river. He sank all the boats, broke the cooking pots and cauldrons, burned the dwellings, and gave each soldier only three days of rations. This showed the soldiers they must die—no one had thoughts of returning. Upon arrival, they surrounded Wang Li. They encountered the Qin army and fought nine battles. They cut off their covered supply walkway, greatly defeated them, killed Su Jiao, and captured Wang Li. She Jian did not surrender to Chu. He burned himself to death. At this time, Chu's troops were the strongest among the feudal lords. The feudal lords' armies that had come to rescue Julu were camped in more than ten fortifications. None dared to unleash their troops. When Chu struck Qin, all the generals observed from atop their fortifications. Chu's warriors were all one matching ten. Chu's troops' battle cries shook heaven. None of the feudal lords' armies were not fearful, every person terrified. Having defeated the Qin army, Xiang Yu summoned the feudal lords' generals. They entered the camp gate, all crawling forward on their knees. None dared to look up. From this point, Xiang Yu became the supreme general of the feudal lords. All the feudal lords came under him.

sentences.zh: 章邯軍棘原，項羽軍漳南，相持未戰。
秦軍數卻，二世使人讓章邯。
章邯恐，使長史欣請事。
至咸陽，留司馬門三日，趙高不見，有不信之心。
長史欣恐，還走其軍，不敢出故道，趙高果使人追之，不及。
欣至軍，報曰：「趙高用事於中，下無可為者。
今戰能勝，高必疾妒吾功；
戰不能勝，不免於死。
願將軍孰計之。」
陳餘亦遺章邯書曰：「白起為秦將，南征鄢郢，北阬馬服，攻城略地，不可勝計，而竟賜死。
蒙恬為秦將，北逐戎人，開榆中地數千里，竟斬陽周。
何者？
功多，秦不能盡封，因以法誅之。
今將軍為秦將三歲矣，所亡失以十萬數，而諸侯并起滋益多。
彼趙高素諛日久，今事急，亦恐二世誅之，故欲以法誅將軍以塞責，使人更代將軍以脫其禍。
夫將軍居外久，多內卻，有功亦誅，無功亦誅。
且天之亡秦，無愚智皆知之。
今將軍內不能直諫，外為亡國將，孤特獨立而欲常存，豈不哀哉！
將軍何不還兵與諸侯為從，約共攻秦，分王其地，南面稱孤；
此孰與身伏鈇質，妻子為僇乎？」
章邯狐疑，陰使候始成使項羽，欲約。
約未成，項羽使蒲將軍日夜引兵度三戶，軍漳南，與秦戰，再破之。
項羽悉引兵擊秦軍汙水上，大破之。

translations.literal: Zhang Han's army was at Jiyuan. Xiang Yu's army was south of the Zhang River. They faced each other but did not fight. The Qin army retreated several times. The Second Generation Emperor sent people to blame Zhang Han. Zhang Han grew fearful. He sent his chief clerk Xin to negotiate surrender. He arrived at Xianyang and waited at the Sima Gate for three days. Zhao Gao did not see him. He had thoughts of distrust. Chief Clerk Xin grew fearful. He returned and fled to his army. He did not dare take the old road. Zhao Gao indeed sent people to pursue him, but they did not catch up. Xin arrived at the army and reported: 'Zhao Gao handles affairs in the court. There is nothing that can be done below. If we win battles now, Gao will quickly envy my merit; If we cannot win battles, we cannot avoid death. I hope the general will carefully consider this.' Chen Yu also sent Zhang Han a letter saying: 'Bai Qi was a Qin general. He conquered Yan and Ying in the south, buried Ma Fu's army in the north, attacked cities and seized lands beyond counting, yet was finally granted death. Meng Tian was a Qin general. He pursued the Rong people north, opened up several thousand li of Yuzhong land, yet was finally beheaded at Yangzhou. Why? Their merits were too many. Qin could not fully reward them, so they executed them by law. The general has been a Qin general for three years. His losses number in the hundreds of thousands. Meanwhile the feudal lords have risen together and grown even more numerous. That Zhao Gao has long been flattering. Now matters are urgent. He also fears the Second Generation will execute him. Therefore he wants to execute the general by law to shift responsibility, and send someone to replace the general to escape his own calamity. The general has been stationed outside for a long time. There have been many retreats within. Whether you have merit or not, you will be executed. Moreover, that Heaven has abandoned Qin—both foolish and wise all know this. Now the general cannot remonstrate directly within, and outside he is the general of a perished state. He stands isolated and alone yet wishes to survive forever. How sorrowful! Why doesn't the general turn his troops and ally with the feudal lords? Agree to attack Qin together, divide and rule its lands, face south and call himself sovereign; How does this compare to prostrating your body on the executioner's block, with your wife and children slaughtered?' Zhang Han hesitated. He secretly sent the scout Shi Cheng as envoy to Xiang Yu, wishing to make an agreement. The agreement was not yet completed. Xiang Yu had General Pu lead troops day and night across Sanhu. The army was south of the Zhang River. They fought with Qin and again defeated them. Xiang Yu led all his troops to strike the Qin army on the Wushui River and greatly defeated them.

sentences.zh: 章邯使人見項羽，欲約。
項羽召軍吏謀曰：「糧少，欲聽其約。」
軍吏皆曰：「善。」
項羽乃與期洹水南殷虛上。
已盟，章邯見項羽而流涕，為言趙高。
項羽乃立章邯為雍王，置楚軍中。
使長史欣為上將軍，將秦軍為前行。

translations.literal: Zhang Han sent people to see Xiang Yu, wishing to make an agreement. Xiang Yu summoned his army officials and consulted, saying: 'Our grain is low. I wish to accept their agreement.' The army officials all said: 'Good.' Xiang Yu then made an appointment with them south of the Huan River at Yinxu. After they allied, Zhang Han saw Xiang Yu and wept, speaking of Zhao Gao. Xiang Yu then established Zhang Han as King of Yong, placing him within the Chu army. He made Chief Clerk Xin supreme general, having him lead the Qin army as the vanguard.

sentences.zh: 到新安。
諸侯吏卒異時故繇使屯戍過秦中，秦中吏卒遇之多無狀，及秦軍降諸侯，諸侯吏卒乘勝多奴虜使之，輕折辱秦吏卒。
秦吏卒多竊言曰：「章將軍等詐吾屬降諸侯，今能入關破秦，大善；
即不能，諸侯虜吾屬而東，秦必盡誅吾父母妻子。」
諸侯微聞其計，以告項羽。
項羽乃召黥布、蒲將軍計曰：「秦吏卒尚眾，其心不服，至關中不聽，事必危，不如擊殺之，而獨與章邯、長史欣、都尉翳入秦。」
於是楚軍夜擊阬秦卒二十餘萬人新安城南。

translations.literal: They arrived at Xin'an. The feudal lords' officials and soldiers, who at different times had been conscripted to garrison and pass through Qin territory, were treated very poorly by Qin's officials and soldiers. Now that the Qin army had surrendered to the feudal lords, the feudal lords' officials and soldiers, riding on victory, often enslaved and used them, lightly breaking and humiliating the Qin officials and soldiers. The Qin officials and soldiers often whispered among themselves: 'General Zhang and the others deceived us into surrendering to the feudal lords. If we can now enter the passes and break Qin, that would be very good; If we cannot, the feudal lords will capture us and go east. Qin will certainly execute all our parents, wives, and children.' The feudal lords secretly heard of their plot and told Xiang Yu. Xiang Yu then summoned Qing Bu and General Pu to consult, saying: 'The Qin officials and soldiers are still numerous. Their hearts do not submit. When we reach Guanzhong they will not obey. This will certainly be dangerous. It is better to strike and kill them, and go alone with Zhang Han, Chief Clerk Xin, and Commandery Captain Yi to enter Qin.' Therefore the Chu army struck at night and buried alive more than two hundred thousand Qin soldiers south of Xin'an city.

sentences.zh: 行略定秦地。
函谷關有兵守關，不得入。
又聞沛公已破咸陽，項羽大怒，使當陽君等擊關。
項羽遂入，至于戲西。
沛公軍霸上，未得與項羽相見。
沛公左司馬曹無傷使人言於項羽曰：「沛公欲王關中，使子嬰為相，珍寶盡有之。」
項羽大怒，曰：「旦日饗士卒，為擊破沛公軍！」
當是時，項羽兵四十萬，在新豐鴻門，沛公兵十萬，在霸上。
范增說項羽曰：「沛公居山東時，貪於財貨，好美姬。
今入關，財物無所取，婦女無所幸，此其志不在小。
吾令人望其氣，皆為龍虎，成五采，此天子氣也。
急擊勿失。」

translations.literal: As they marched, they raided and pacified Qin territory. Hangu Pass had troops guarding it. They could not enter. They then heard that Liu Bang had already broken Xianyang. Xiang Yu was greatly angered. He had Lord Dangyang and others strike the pass. Xiang Yu then entered and arrived west of Xi. Liu Bang's army was at Bashang. He had not yet been able to meet with Xiang Yu. Liu Bang's left adjutant Cao Wushang sent people to speak to Xiang Yu, saying: 'Liu Bang wishes to rule Guanzhong as king, make Zi Ying his chancellor, and possess all the precious treasures.' Xiang Yu was greatly angered and said: 'Tomorrow I will feast the soldiers, then strike and break Liu Bang's army!' At this time, Xiang Yu had four hundred thousand troops at Hongmen in Xinfeng. Liu Bang had one hundred thousand troops at Bashang. Fan Zeng advised Xiang Yu, saying: 'When Liu Bang resided in Shandong, he was greedy for wealth and goods, fond of beautiful women. Now he has entered the passes but taken no wealth or goods, favored no women. His ambitions are not small. I had people observe his aura. It was all dragon and tiger, forming the five colors. This is the aura of a Son of Heaven. Strike quickly. Do not lose this opportunity.'

sentences.zh: 楚左尹項伯者，項羽季父也，素善留侯張良。
張良是時從沛公，項伯乃夜馳之沛公軍，私見張良，具告以事，欲呼張良與俱去。
曰：「毋從俱死也。」
張良曰：「臣為韓王送沛公，沛公今事有急，亡去不義，不可不語。」
良乃入，具告沛公。
沛公大驚，曰：「為之柰何？」
張良曰：「誰為大王為此計者？」
曰：「鯫生說我曰『距關，毋內諸侯，秦地可盡王也』。
故聽之。」
良曰：「料大王士卒足以當項王乎？」
沛公默然，曰：「固不如也，且為之柰何？」
張良曰：「請往謂項伯，言沛公不敢背項王也。」
沛公曰：「君安與項伯有故？」
張良曰：「秦時與臣游，項伯殺人，臣活之。
今事有急，故幸來告良。」
沛公曰「孰與君少長？」
良曰：「長於臣。」
沛公曰「君為我呼入，吾得兄事之。」
張良出，要項伯。
項伯即入見沛公。
沛公奉卮酒為壽，約為婚姻，曰：「吾入關，秋豪不敢有所近，籍吏民，封府庫，而待將軍。
所以遣將守關者，備他盜之出入與非常也。
日夜望將軍至，豈敢反乎！
願伯具言臣之不敢倍德也。」
項伯許諾。
謂沛公曰：「旦日不可不蚤自來謝項王。」
沛公曰：「諾。」
於是項伯復夜去，至軍中，具以沛公言報項王。
因言曰：「沛公不先破關中，公豈敢入乎？
今人有大功而擊之，不義也，不如因善遇之。」
項王許諾。

translations.literal: Xiang Bo, Chu's left minister, was Xiang Yu's youngest uncle. He had long been good friends with Marquis Liu Zhang Liang. Zhang Liang was at this time following Liu Bang. Xiang Bo then galloped at night to Liu Bang's army. He privately saw Zhang Liang and fully told him the matters, wishing to call Zhang Liang to go with him. He said: 'Do not follow him and die together.' Zhang Liang said: 'I escorted Liu Bang for the King of Han. Liu Bang's matters are now urgent. To flee would not be righteous. I cannot fail to tell him.' Liang then entered and fully told Liu Bang. Liu Bang was greatly startled and said: 'What should I do?' Zhang Liang said: 'Who devised this plan for the great king?' He said: 'A small man advised me, saying "Bar the pass, do not admit the feudal lords. You can rule all Qin lands." So I listened to him.' Liang said: 'Do you estimate that the great king's soldiers are sufficient to match King Xiang?' Liu Bang was silent, then said: 'Certainly not equal. Moreover, what should I do?' Zhang Liang said: 'Please go tell Xiang Bo that Liu Bang dares not turn against King Xiang.' Liu Bang said: 'Sir, how do you have an old friendship with Xiang Bo?' Zhang Liang said: 'During Qin times, Xiang Bo wandered with me. Xiang Bo killed a man, and I saved him. Now matters are urgent, so fortunately he came to tell me.' Liu Bang said: 'Who is younger or older than you?' Liang said: 'Older than me.' Liu Bang said: 'Sir, call him in for me. I will treat him as an elder brother.' Zhang Liang went out and intercepted Xiang Bo. Xiang Bo immediately entered and saw Liu Bang. Liu Bang offered a goblet of wine as a toast and agreed to marriage, saying: 'When I entered the passes, I dared not approach even the smallest thing. I registered the officials and people, sealed the treasuries, and waited for the general. The reason I sent a general to guard the pass was to prepare for other bandits entering and exiting, and for extraordinary circumstances. Day and night I hoped for the general to arrive. How would I dare rebel! I hope you will fully explain that I, your minister, do not dare to betray virtue.' Xiang Bo agreed. He said to Liu Bang: 'Tomorrow you must come early to apologize to King Xiang.' Liu Bang said: 'Yes.' Therefore Xiang Bo again left at night and arrived in the army camp. He fully reported Liu Bang's words to King Xiang. He then said: 'If Liu Bang had not first broken Guanzhong, how would you have dared to enter? Now someone has achieved great merit, yet you would strike him. That is not righteous. It is better to take advantage of this and treat him well.' King Xiang agreed.

sentences.zh: 沛公旦日從百餘騎來見項王，至鴻門，謝曰：「臣與將軍戮力而攻秦，將軍戰河北，臣戰河南，然不自意能先入關破秦，得復見將軍於此。
今者有小人之言，令將軍與臣有郤。」
項王曰：「此沛公左司馬曹無傷言之；
不然，籍何以至此。」
項王即日因留沛公與飲。
項王、項伯東向坐。
亞父南向坐。
亞父者，范增也。
沛公北向坐，張良西向侍。
范增數目項王，舉所佩玉珪以示之者三，項王默然不應。
范增起，出召項莊，謂曰：「君王為人不忍，若入前為壽，壽畢，請以劍舞，因擊沛公於坐，殺之。
不者，若屬皆且為所虜。」
莊則入為壽，壽畢，曰：「君王與沛公飲，軍中無以為樂，請以劍舞。」
項王曰：「諾。」
項莊拔劍起舞，項伯亦拔劍起舞，常以身翼蔽沛公，莊不得擊。
於是張良至軍門，見樊噲。
樊噲曰：「今日之事何如？」
良曰：「甚急。
今者項莊拔劍舞，其意常在沛公也。」
噲曰：「此迫矣，臣請入，與之同命。」
噲即帶劍擁盾入軍門。
交戟之衛士欲止不內，樊噲側其盾以撞，衛士仆地，噲遂入，披帷西向立，瞋目視項王，頭髪上指，目眥盡裂。
項王按劍而跽曰：「客何為者？」
張良曰：「沛公之參乘樊噲者也。」
項王曰：「壯士，賜之卮酒。」
則與斗卮酒。
噲拜謝，起，立而飲之。
項王曰：「賜之彘肩。」
則與一生彘肩。
樊噲覆其盾於地，加彘肩上，拔劍切而啗之。
項王曰：「壯士，能復飲乎？」
樊噲曰：「臣死且不避，卮酒安足辭！
夫秦王有虎狼之心，殺人如不能舉，刑人如恐不勝，天下皆叛之。
懷王與諸將約曰『先破秦入咸陽者王之』。
今沛公先破秦入咸陽，豪毛不敢有所近，封閉宮室，還軍霸上，以待大王來。
故遣將守關者，備他盜出入與非常也。
勞苦而功高如此，未有封侯之賞，而聽細說，欲誅有功之人。
此亡秦之續耳，竊為大王不取也。」
項王未有以應，曰：「坐。」
樊噲從良坐。
坐須臾，沛公起如廁，因招樊噲出。

translations.literal: The next day Liu Bang came to see King Xiang with more than a hundred riders. He arrived at Hongmen and apologized, saying: 'Your minister united with the general to attack Qin. The general fought north of the river, your minister fought south of the river. Yet I did not expect to be able to enter the passes first and break Qin, and thus meet the general again here. Now there are the words of petty men, causing a rift between the general and your minister.' King Xiang said: 'This was spoken by Liu Bang's left adjutant Cao Wushang; Otherwise, why would I, Ji, have come to this point.' King Xiang therefore kept Liu Bang that day and drank with him. King Xiang and Xiang Bo sat facing east. Yafu sat facing south. Yafu was Fan Zeng. Liu Bang sat facing north. Zhang Liang served facing west. Fan Zeng frequently glanced at King Xiang. He raised his jade tablet three times to signal him. King Xiang remained silent and did not respond. Fan Zeng rose and went out to summon Xiang Zhuang. He said: 'Our lord king is not a cruel person. If you enter and make a toast first, and when the toast is finished, request to dance with swords, then take advantage to strike Liu Bang at his seat and kill him. If not, you and all your kind will moreover be captured by him.' Zhuang then entered and made a toast. When the toast was finished, he said: 'The lord king is drinking with Liu Bang. The army has nothing for merriment. Please allow me to dance with swords.' King Xiang said: 'Yes.' Xiang Zhuang drew his sword and began to dance. Xiang Bo also drew his sword and danced. He constantly used his body to flank and shield Liu Bang. Zhuang could not strike. Therefore Zhang Liang went to the army gate and saw Fan Kuai. Fan Kuai said: 'How are matters today?' Liang said: 'Very urgent. Now Xiang Zhuang draws his sword and dances. His intent is constantly on Liu Bang.' Kuai said: 'This is critical. Your minister requests to enter and share the same fate with him.' Kuai immediately strapped on his sword, embraced his shield, and entered the army gate. The guards with crossed halberds wished to stop him and not admit him. Fan Kuai tilted his shield to collide with them. The guards fell to the ground. Kuai then entered, parted the curtain, stood facing west, glared at King Xiang with his eyes. His hair stood on end, his eyes were completely bloodshot. King Xiang pressed his sword and knelt, saying: 'What is this guest doing?' Zhang Liang said: 'He is Liu Bang's chariot driver, Fan Kuai.' King Xiang said: 'Brave warrior. Grant him a goblet of wine.' They then gave him a large goblet of wine. Kuai bowed in thanks, rose, stood and drank it. King Xiang said: 'Grant him a pork shoulder.' They then gave him a whole pork shoulder. Fan Kuai overturned his shield on the ground, placed the pork shoulder on it, drew his sword, cut it, and ate it. King Xiang said: 'Brave warrior, can you drink more?' Fan Kuai said: 'Your minister would not avoid even death. How could I refuse a goblet of wine! The Qin king has the heart of a tiger or wolf. He kills people as if unable to lift them all, punishes people as if fearing not enough. The world has all rebelled against him. King Huai agreed with the generals that 'Whoever first breaks Qin and enters Xianyang will rule it.' Now Liu Bang first broke Qin and entered Xianyang. He dared not approach even the smallest thing. He sealed the palaces, returned his army to Bashang, and waited for the great king to come. Therefore he sent a general to guard the pass, to prepare for other bandits entering and exiting, and for extraordinary circumstances. To have toiled and achieved such high merit, yet not received the reward of enfeoffment as marquis, and instead listen to petty slander, desiring to execute meritorious people. This is just continuing the ways of perished Qin. I secretly advise the great king not to do this.' King Xiang had nothing to respond with and said: 'Sit.' Fan Kuai sat next to Liang. After sitting a brief moment, Liu Bang rose as if going to the toilet, and took advantage to beckon Fan Kuai out.

sentences.zh: 沛公已出，項王使都尉陳平召沛公。
沛公曰：「今者出，未辭也，為之柰何？」
樊噲曰：「大行不顧細謹，大禮不辭小讓。
如今人方為刀俎，我為魚肉，何辭為。」
於是遂去。
乃令張良留謝。
良問曰：「大王來何操？」
曰：「我持白璧一雙，欲獻項王，玉斗一雙，欲與亞父，會其怒，不敢獻。
公為我獻之」張良曰：「謹諾。」
當是時，項王軍在鴻門下，沛公軍在霸上，相去四十里。
沛公則置車騎，脫身獨騎，與樊噲、夏侯嬰、靳彊、紀信等四人持劍盾步走，從酈山下，道芷陽閒行。
沛公謂張良曰：「從此道至吾軍，不過二十里耳。
度我至軍中，公乃入。」
沛公已去，閒至軍中，張良入謝，曰：「沛公不勝桮杓，不能辭。
謹使臣良奉白璧一雙，再拜獻大王足下；
玉斗一雙，再拜奉大將軍足下。」
項王曰：「沛公安在？」
良曰：「聞大王有意督過之，脫身獨去，已至軍矣。」
項王則受璧，置之坐上。
亞父受玉斗，置之地，拔劍撞而破之，曰：「唉！
豎子不足與謀。
奪項王天下者，必沛公也，吾屬今為之虜矣。」
沛公至軍，立誅殺曹無傷。

translations.literal: Liu Bang had already left. King Xiang sent Commandery Captain Chen Ping to summon Liu Bang back. Liu Bang said: 'I left just now without taking leave. What should I do?' Fan Kuai said: 'Great undertakings do not consider petty cautions. Great rites do not refuse small concessions. Now people are just the knife and chopping block, we are the fish and meat. What ceremony is there for?' Therefore he left. He then ordered Zhang Liang to stay and apologize. Liang asked: 'What did the great king bring?' He said: 'I brought a pair of white jade discs, intending to offer them to King Xiang, and a pair of jade goblets, intending to give them to Yafu. But encountering his anger, I did not dare offer them. You offer them for me.' Zhang Liang said: 'Respectfully, yes.' At this time, King Xiang's army was below Hongmen. Liu Bang's army was at Bashang. They were forty li apart. Liu Bang then abandoned his chariot and cavalry. He escaped alone on horseback with Fan Kuai, Xiahou Ying, Jin Qiang, and Ji Xin—these four men carrying swords and shields—walking on foot. They went from below Mount Li, taking the road through Zhiyang. Liu Bang said to Zhang Liang: 'From this road to my army, it's not over twenty li. Estimate when I arrive in the army camp, then you enter.' Liu Bang had already left. After a while he arrived in the army camp. Zhang Liang entered and apologized, saying: 'Liu Bang was overcome by the wine and could not take leave. Respectfully, your minister Liang presents a pair of white jade discs. I twice bow and offer them to the great king's feet; A pair of jade goblets. I twice bow and present them to the great general's feet.' King Xiang said: 'Where is Liu Bang?' Liang said: 'He heard the great king intended to blame him. He escaped alone and left. He has already arrived at his army.' King Xiang then received the jade disc and placed it on his seat. Yafu received the jade goblet, placed it on the ground, drew his sword, struck it, and broke it, saying: 'Alas! This youngster is not worth planning with. The one who will seize King Xiang's world will certainly be Liu Bang. We will now become his captives.' Liu Bang arrived at his army and immediately executed Cao Wushang.

sentences.zh: 居數日，項羽引兵西屠咸陽，殺秦降王子嬰，燒秦宮室，火三月不滅；
收其貨寶婦女而東。
人或說項王曰：「關中阻山河四塞，地肥饒，可都以霸。」
項王見秦宮皆以燒殘破，又心懷思欲東歸，曰：「富貴不歸故鄉，如衣繡夜行，誰知之者！」
說者曰：「人言楚人沐猴而冠耳，果然。」
項王聞之，烹說者。

translations.literal: After several days, Xiang Yu led his troops west and slaughtered Xianyang. He killed the Qin surrendered prince Zi Ying, burned the Qin palaces. The fire did not extinguish for three months; He collected their goods, treasures, and women and went east. Someone advised King Xiang, saying: 'Guanzhong is blocked by mountains and rivers on four sides. The land is fertile and rich. You can make it your capital and dominate.' King Xiang saw that all the Qin palaces were burned and ruined. Moreover, his heart longed to return east. He said: 'Wealth and nobility without returning to your hometown is like wearing embroidered clothes while walking at night—who would know!' The adviser said: 'People say Chu people are bathing monkeys wearing hats. Indeed.' King Xiang heard it and boiled the adviser.

sentences.zh: 項王使人致命懷王。
懷王曰：「如約。」
乃尊懷王為義帝。
項王欲自王，先王諸將相。
謂曰：「天下初發難時，假立諸侯後以伐秦。
然身被堅執銳首事，暴露於野三年，滅秦定天下者，皆將相諸君與籍之力也。
義帝雖無功，故當分其地而王之。」
諸將皆曰：「善。」
乃分天下，立諸將為侯王。
項王、范增疑沛公之有天下，業已講解，又惡負約，恐諸侯叛之，乃陰謀曰：「巴、蜀道險，秦之遷人皆居蜀。」
乃曰：「巴、蜀亦關中地也。」
故立沛公為漢王，王巴、蜀、漢中，都南鄭。
而三分關中，王秦降將以距塞漢王。
項王乃立章邯為雍王，王咸陽以西，都廢丘。
長史欣者，故為櫟陽獄掾，嘗有德於項梁；
都尉董翳者，本勸章邯降楚。
故立司馬欣為塞王，王咸陽以東至河，都櫟陽；
立董翳為翟王，王上郡，都高奴。
徙魏王豹為西魏王，王河東，都平陽。
瑕丘申陽者，張耳嬖臣也，先下河南（郡），迎楚河上，故立申陽為河南王，都雒陽。
韓王成因故都，都陽翟。
趙將司馬卬定河內，數有功，故立卬為殷王，王河內，都朝歌。
徙趙王歇為代王。
趙相張耳素賢，又從入關，故立耳為常山王，王趙地，都襄國。
當陽君黥布為楚將，常冠軍，故立布為九江王，都六。
鄱君吳芮率百越佐諸侯，又從入關，故立芮為衡山王，都邾。
義帝柱國共敖將兵擊南郡，功多，因立敖為臨江王，都江陵。
徙燕王韓廣為遼東王。
燕將臧荼從楚救趙，因從入關，故立荼為燕王，都薊。
徙齊王田市為膠東王。
齊將田都從共救趙，因從入關，故立都為齊王，都臨菑。
故秦所滅齊王建孫田安，項羽方渡河救趙，田安下濟北數城，引其兵降項羽，故立安為濟北王，都博陽。
田榮者，數負項梁，又不肯將兵從楚擊秦，以故不封。
成安君陳餘棄將印去，不從入關，然素聞其賢，有功於趙，聞其在南皮，故因環封三縣。
番君將梅鋗功多，故封十萬戶侯。
項王自立為西楚霸王，王九郡，都彭城。

translations.literal: King Xiang sent people to report the command to King Huai. King Huai said: 'As agreed.' He then honored King Huai as the Righteous Emperor. King Xiang wished to be king himself. He first enfeoffed the various generals and ministers as kings. He said: 'When the world initially began its difficulties, we temporarily established the feudal lords' descendants to attack Qin. Yet those who personally wore armor and wielded sharp weapons, who first began the matters and were exposed in the wilds for three years, who extinguished Qin and settled the world—all were through the strength of you various lords generals and ministers with me, Ji. The Righteous Emperor, though he has no merit, should therefore have his lands divided and be made king of them.' All the generals said: 'Good.' He then divided the world and established the various generals as marquises and kings. King Xiang and Fan Zeng suspected Liu Bang would take the world. They had already reconciled, but moreover hated to break the agreement and feared the feudal lords would rebel against him. They then secretly planned, saying: 'The Ba and Shu roads are dangerous. Qin's banished people all reside in Shu.' He then said: 'Ba and Shu are also Guanzhong territory.' Therefore he established Liu Bang as Han King, to rule Ba, Shu, and Hanzhong, with his capital at Nanzheng. He divided Guanzhong into three parts and enfeoffed Qin surrendered generals to block and bar the Han King. King Xiang then established Zhang Han as Yong King, to rule west of Xianyang, with his capital at Feiqiu. Chief Clerk Xin had formerly been a Queyang prison clerk and once shown virtue to Xiang Liang; Commandery Captain Dong Yi had originally advised Zhang Han to surrender to Chu. Therefore he established Sima Xin as Sai King, to rule from Xianyang east to the river, with his capital at Queyang; He established Dong Yi as Di King, to rule Shang commandery, with his capital at Gaonu. He moved King Wei Bao to become West Wei King, to rule Hedong, with his capital at Pingyang. Xiaqiu's Shen Yang was Zhang Er's favorite minister. He first submitted Henan commandery and welcomed Chu on the river. Therefore he established Shen Yang as Henan King, with his capital at Luoyang. King Han Cheng kept his old capital, with his capital at Yangdi. Zhao general Sima Ang pacified Henan and had merit several times. Therefore he established Ang as Yin King, to rule Henan, with his capital at Zhaoge. He moved King Zhao Xie to become Dai King. Zhao chancellor Zhang Er was originally worthy and moreover followed into the passes. Therefore he established Er as Changshan King, to rule Zhao territory, with his capital at Xiangguo. Lord Dangyang Qing Bu was a Chu general and constantly the champion. Therefore he established Bu as Jiujiang King, with his capital at Liu. Lord Po Wu Rui led the hundred Yue to assist the feudal lords and moreover followed into the passes. Therefore he established Rui as Hengshan King, with his capital at Zhu. The Righteous Emperor's supreme pillar of state Gong Ao led troops to strike Nan commandery. His merit was great, so he established Ao as Linjiang King, with his capital at Jiangling. He moved King Yan Han Guang to become Liaodong King. Yan general Zang Tu followed Chu to rescue Zhao and moreover followed into the passes. Therefore he established Tu as Yan King, with his capital at Ji. He moved King Qi Tian Shi to become Jiaodong King. Qi general Tian Du followed to rescue Zhao together and moreover followed into the passes. Therefore he established Du as Qi King, with his capital at Linzi. Tian An was the grandson of the Qi King Jian whom Qin had extinguished. Xiang Yu was just crossing the river to rescue Zhao when Tian An submitted several Jibei cities and led his troops to surrender to Xiang Yu. Therefore he established An as Jibei King, with his capital at Boyang. Tian Rong had several times betrayed Xiang Liang and moreover was not willing to lead troops to follow Chu in striking Qin. For this reason he was not enfeoffed. Lord Cheng'an Chen Yu abandoned his general's seal and left, did not follow into the passes. Yet he was originally known as worthy and had merit to Zhao. He heard he was at Nanpi, so accordingly he enfeoffed him with three surrounding counties. Lord Fan's general Mei Dun had great merit, so he enfeoffed him as marquis of one hundred thousand households. King Xiang self-established as Western Chu Hegemon King, ruling nine commanderies, with his capital at Pengcheng.

sentences.zh: 漢之元年四月，諸侯罷戲下，各就國。
項王出之國，使人徙義帝，曰：「古之帝者地方千里，必居上游。」
乃使使徙義帝長沙郴縣。
趣義帝行，其群臣稍稍背叛之，乃陰令衡山、臨江王擊殺之江中。
韓王成無軍功，項王不使之國，與俱至彭城，廢以為侯，已又殺之。
臧荼之國，因逐韓廣之遼東，廣弗聽，荼擊殺廣無終，

translations.literal: In Han's first year, fourth month, the feudal lords were dismissed from below Xi and each went to their states. King Xiang sent him out to his state and had people move the Righteous Emperor, saying: 'Ancient emperors had territories of a thousand li and must reside upstream.' He then sent envoys to move the Righteous Emperor to Chen county in Changsha. He urged the Righteous Emperor to go. His ministers gradually betrayed him one by one. He then secretly ordered the Hengshan and Linjiang Kings to strike and kill him in the Jiang River. King Han Cheng had no military merit. King Xiang did not make him go to his state. He brought him along to Pengcheng, abolished him to marquis, and then moreover killed him. Zang Tu went to his state and took advantage to expel Han Guang to Liaodong. Guang did not listen. Tu struck and killed Guang at Wuzhong,

sentences.zh: 田榮聞項羽徙齊王市膠東，而立齊將田都為齊王，乃大怒，不肯遣齊王之膠東，因以齊反，迎擊田都。
田都走楚。
齊王市畏項王，乃亡之膠東就國。
田榮怒，追擊殺之即墨。
榮因自立為齊王，而西殺擊濟北王田安，并王三齊。
榮與彭越將軍印，令反梁地。
陳餘陰使張同、夏說說齊王田榮曰：「項羽為天下宰，不平。
今盡王故王於醜地，而王其群臣諸將善地，逐其故主趙王，乃北居代，餘以為不可。
聞大王起兵，且不聽不義，願大王資餘兵，請以擊常山，以復趙王，請以國為捍蔽。」
齊王許之，因遣兵之趙。
陳餘悉發三縣兵，與齊并力擊常山，大破之。
張耳走歸漢。
陳餘迎故趙王歇於代，反之趙。
趙王因立陳餘為代王。

translations.literal: Tian Rong heard that Xiang Yu had moved King Qi Tian Shi to Jiaodong and established the Qi general Tian Du as Qi King. He then became greatly angered and was not willing to send King Qi to Jiaodong. He took advantage to rebel with Qi and welcomed the attack on Tian Du. Tian Du fled to Chu. King Qi Tian Shi feared King Xiang and then fled to Jiaodong to take his state. Tian Rong became angered and pursued and struck and killed him at Jimo. Rong took advantage to self-establish as Qi King, and to the west killed and struck Jibei King Tian An, uniting and ruling the three Qi territories. Rong gave Peng Yue the general's seal and ordered him to rebel in Liang territory. Chen Yu secretly sent Zhang Tong and Xia Shuo to persuade King Qi Tian Rong, saying: 'Xiang Yu is steward of the world, but it is not fair. Now he completely enfeoffs former kings in ugly territories, and enfeoffs his ministers and various generals in good territories. He expelled their former lord King Zhao, and moreover had him reside north in Dai. I, Yu, consider this not possible. I heard the great king has raised troops, and moreover does not listen to what is not righteous. I wish the great king would supply me, Yu, with troops. I request to strike Changshan, to restore King Zhao. I request to use the state as a shield and barrier.' King Qi permitted it and took advantage to send troops to Zhao. Chen Yu completely dispatched the three counties' troops and with Qi combined their strength to strike Changshan, greatly defeating it. Zhang Er fled and returned to Han. Chen Yu welcomed the former King Zhao Xie from Dai and returned him to Zhao. King Zhao took advantage to establish Chen Yu as Dai King.

sentences.zh: 是時，漢還定三秦。
項羽聞漢王皆已并關中，且東，齊、趙叛之：大怒。
乃以故吳令鄭昌為韓王，以距漢。
令蕭公角等擊彭越。
彭越敗蕭公角等。
漢使張良徇韓，乃遺項王書曰：「漢王失職，欲得關中，如約即止，不敢東。」
又以齊、梁反書遺項王曰：「齊欲與趙并滅楚。」
楚以此故無西意，而北擊齊。
徵兵九江王布。
布稱疾不往，使將將數千人行。
項王由此怨布也。
漢之二年冬，項羽遂北至城陽，田榮亦將兵會戰。
田榮不勝，走至平原，平原民殺之。
遂北燒夷齊城郭室屋，皆阬田榮降卒，系虜其老弱婦女。
徇齊至北海，多所殘滅。
齊人相聚而叛之。
於是田榮弟田橫收齊亡卒得數萬人，反城陽。
項王因留，連戰未能下。

translations.literal: At this time, Han returned and pacified the three Qin territories. Xiang Yu heard that Han King had already united all of Guanzhong and moreover was advancing east, and that Qi and Zhao had rebelled against him. He became greatly angered. He then made the former Wu magistrate Zheng Chang Han King, to resist Han. He ordered Xiao Gong Jiao and others to strike Peng Yue. Peng Yue defeated Xiao Gong Jiao and others. Han sent Zhang Liang to tour Han, then sent King Xiang a letter saying: 'Han King has lost his position. He wishes to get Guanzhong. As per the agreement, he will then stop and not dare to advance east.' He again sent King Xiang letters about Qi and Liang's rebellion, saying: 'Qi wishes to unite with Zhao and extinguish Chu.' Chu, for this reason, had no intention to go west, and instead struck north at Qi. He conscripted troops from Jiujiang King Bu. Bu claimed illness and did not go. He had a general lead several thousand people who went. King Xiang from this resented Bu. In Han's second year, winter, Xiang Yu then went north to Chengyang. Tian Rong also led troops to assemble for battle. Tian Rong was not victorious. He fled to Pingyuan, where the Pingyuan people killed him. He then went north and burned and razed Qi's city walls and houses. He buried alive all of Tian Rong's surrendered soldiers and bound and captured their old, weak, and women. He toured Qi and arrived at Beihai, destroying and extinguishing much. The Qi people gathered together and rebelled against him. Therefore Tian Rong's younger brother Tian Heng gathered Qi's scattered soldiers, getting several ten thousand people, and rebelled at Chengyang. King Xiang took advantage to stay. Continuous battles could not conquer it.

sentences.zh: 春，漢王部五諸侯兵，凡五十六萬人，東伐楚。
項王聞之，即令諸將擊齊，而自以精兵三萬人南從魯出胡陵。
四月，漢皆已入彭城，收其貨寶美人，日置酒高會。
項王乃西從蕭，晨擊漢軍而東，至彭城，日中，大破漢軍。
漢軍皆走，相隨入穀、泗水，殺漢卒十餘萬人。
漢卒皆南走山，楚又追擊至靈壁東睢水上。
漢軍卻，為楚所擠，多殺，漢卒十餘萬人皆入睢水，睢水為之不流。
圍漢王三匝。
於是大風從西北而起，折木發屋，揚沙石，窈冥晝晦，逢迎楚軍。
楚軍大亂，壞散，而漢王乃得與數十騎遁去，欲過沛，收家室而西；
楚亦使人追之沛，取漢王家：家皆亡，不與漢王相見。
漢王道逢得孝惠、魯元，乃載行。
楚騎追漢王，漢王急，推墮孝惠、魯元車下，滕公常下收載之。
如是者三。
曰：「雖急不可以驅，柰何棄之？」
於是遂得脫。
求太公、呂后不相遇。
審食其從太公、呂后閒行，求漢王，反遇楚軍。
楚軍遂與歸，報項王，項王常置軍中。

translations.literal: In spring, Han King commanded the five feudal lords' troops, altogether five hundred sixty thousand people, and attacked east against Chu. King Xiang heard it and immediately ordered the various generals to strike Qi, while he himself, with thirty thousand elite troops, went south from Lu and emerged at Huling. In the fourth month, Han had all entered Pengcheng. They collected its goods, treasures, and beauties. Daily they arranged wine and grand gatherings. King Xiang then came west from Xiao. In the morning he struck the Han army and went east. He arrived at Pengcheng at noon and greatly defeated the Han army. The Han army all fled, following each other into the Gu and Si rivers. They killed more than one hundred thousand Han soldiers. The Han soldiers all fled south to the mountains. Chu again pursued and struck them east of Lingbi on the Sui River. The Han army retreated, squeezed by Chu, much killed. More than one hundred thousand Han soldiers all entered the Sui River. The Sui River because of this did not flow. They surrounded Han King three times around. Therefore a great wind arose from the northwest. It broke trees and tore roofs. It raised sand and stones. It darkened midday into darkness. It met and welcomed the Chu army. The Chu army became greatly disordered and ruined and scattered. Han King then got to escape and go with several dozen riders. He wished to pass through Pei, collect his family, and go west; Chu also sent people to pursue him to Pei and take Han King's family. The family had all fled and did not meet with Han King. Han King encountered Xiao Hui and Lu Yuan on the road. He then carried them along. Chu cavalry pursued Han King. Han King was urgent. He pushed Xiao Hui and Lu Yuan to fall below the cart. Teng Gong often descended and collected and carried them. Like this three times. He said: 'Though urgent, we cannot hurry. How can we abandon them?' Therefore he then got to escape. He sought Tai Gong and Lu Hou but did not meet them. Shen Yiqi followed Tai Gong and Lu Hou as they stealthily went seeking Han King. Instead they encountered the Chu army. The Chu army then returned with them and reported to King Xiang. King Xiang often placed them in the army camp.

sentences.zh: 是時呂后兄周呂侯為漢將兵居下邑，漢王閒往從之，稍稍收其士卒。
至滎陽，諸敗軍皆會，蕭何亦發關中老弱未傅悉詣滎陽，復大振。
楚起於彭城，常乘勝逐北，與漢戰滎陽南京、索閒，漢敗楚，楚以故不能過滎陽而西。

translations.literal: At this time, Lu Hou's brother Zhou Lu Hou was leading troops for Han and residing at Xiayi. Han King stealthily went and followed him. Gradually he gathered his soldiers. He arrived at Xingyang. The various defeated armies all assembled. Xiao He also dispatched Guanzhong's old and weak who were not registered and had them all go to Xingyang. He again greatly flourished. Chu arose from Pengcheng. They often rode on victory and pursued north. They fought with Han at Xingyang's southern capital and between Su. Han defeated Chu. Therefore Chu could not pass Xingyang and go west.

sentences.zh: 項王之救彭城，追漢王至滎陽，田橫亦得收齊，立田榮子廣為齊王。
漢王之敗彭城，諸侯皆復與楚而背漢。
漢軍滎陽，筑甬道屬之河，以取敖倉粟。
漢之三年，項王數侵奪漢甬道，漢王食乏，恐，請和，割滎陽以西為漢。

translations.literal: King Xiang relieved Pengcheng and pursued Han King to Xingyang. Tian Heng also got to gather Qi and established Tian Rong's son Guang as Qi King. Han King was defeated at Pengcheng. The feudal lords all again sided with Chu and turned against Han. The Han army was at Xingyang. They built a covered road connecting to the river to take grain from the Ao granary. In Han's third year, King Xiang several times invaded and seized Han's covered road. Han King lacked food and feared. He requested peace and divided Xingyang west as Han territory.

sentences.zh: 項王欲聽之。
歷陽侯范增曰：「漢易與耳，今釋弗取，後必悔之。」
項王乃與范增急圍滎陽。
漢王患之，乃用陳平計閒項王。
項王使者來，為太牢具，舉欲進之。
見使者，詳驚愕曰：「吾以為亞父使者，乃反項王使者。」
更持去，以惡食食項王使者。
使者歸報項王，項王乃疑范增與漢有私，稍奪之權。
范增大怒，曰：「天下事大定矣，君王自為之。
願賜骸骨歸卒伍。」
項王許之。
行未至彭城，疽發背而死。

translations.literal: King Xiang wished to listen to it. Lord Liyang Fan Zeng said: 'Han is easy to deal with. Now if we release and do not take them, later we must regret it.' King Xiang then with Fan Zeng urgently surrounded Xingyang. Han King was worried by it. He then used Chen Ping's plan to sow discord with King Xiang. King Xiang's envoy came. They prepared a great sacrificial feast and raised it, wishing to present it. He saw the envoy and pretended to be startled and astonished, saying: 'I thought it was Yafu's envoy, but instead it is King Xiang's envoy.' He again held and went, feeding King Xiang's envoy with inferior food. The envoy returned and reported to King Xiang. King Xiang then suspected Fan Zeng had private dealings with Han and gradually seized his authority. Fan Zeng was greatly angered and said: 'World affairs are greatly settled. Lord king, do it yourself. I wish to be granted my remains and return to the common soldier ranks.' King Xiang permitted it. He traveled but had not yet arrived at Pengcheng when an ulcer erupted on his back and he died.

sentences.zh: 漢將紀信說漢王曰：「事已急矣，請為王誑楚為王，王可以閒出。」
於是漢王夜出女子滎陽東門被甲二千人，楚兵四面擊之。
紀信乘黃屋車，傅左纛，曰：「城中食盡，漢王降。」
楚軍皆呼萬歲。
漢王亦與數十騎從城西門出，走成皋。
項王見紀信，問：「漢王安在？」
曰：「漢王已出矣。」
項王燒殺紀信。

translations.literal: Han general Ji Xin advised Han King, saying: 'Matters are already urgent. Please allow me to deceive Chu by posing as king. The king can then stealthily leave.' Therefore Han King at night sent out women through Xingyang's east gate, armored with two thousand people. Chu troops struck them from four sides. Ji Xin rode the yellow-canopied chariot and attached the left banner, saying: 'The city has exhausted its food. Han King surrenders.' The Chu army all called 'ten thousand years.' Han King also with several dozen riders went out the city's west gate and fled to Chenggao. King Xiang saw Ji Xin and asked: 'Where is Han King?' He said: 'Han King has already left.' King Xiang burned and killed Ji Xin.

sentences.zh: 漢王使御史大夫周苛、樅公、魏豹守滎陽。
周苛、樅公謀曰：「反國之王，難與守城。」
乃共殺魏豹。
楚下滎陽城，生得周苛。
項王謂周苛曰：「為我將，我以公為上將軍，封三萬戶。」
周苛罵曰：「若不趣降漢，漢今虜若，若非漢敵也。」
項王怒，烹周苛，井殺樅公。

translations.literal: Han King made Imperial Secretary Zhou Ke, Cong Gong, and Wei Bao defend Xingyang. Zhou Ke and Cong Gong plotted, saying: 'A king from a rebel state is difficult to defend the city with.' They then together killed Wei Bao. Chu conquered Xingyang city and captured Zhou Ke alive. King Xiang said to Zhou Ke: 'Be my general. I will make you supreme general and enfeoff you with thirty thousand households.' Zhou Ke cursed and said: 'If you do not quickly surrender to Han, Han will now capture you. You are no enemy of Han.' King Xiang was angered. He boiled Zhou Ke and killed Cong Gong by casting him into a well.

sentences.zh: 漢王之出滎陽，南走宛、葉，得九江王布，行收兵，復入保成皋。
漢之四年，項王進兵圍成皋。
漢王逃，獨與滕公出成皋北門，渡河走修武，從張耳、韓信軍。
諸將稍稍得出成皋，從漢王。
楚遂拔成皋，欲西。
漢使兵距之鞏，令其不得西。

translations.literal: After Han King left Xingyang, he fled south to Wan and Ye. He got Jiujiang King Bu, gathered troops en route, and again entered to defend Chenggao. In Han's fourth year, King Xiang advanced his troops and surrounded Chenggao. Han King fled. Alone with Teng Gong, he went out Chenggao's north gate, crossed the river, fled to Xiuwu, and followed Zhang Er and Han Xin's army. The various generals gradually got out of Chenggao and followed Han King. Chu then captured Chenggao and wished to go west. Han sent troops to resist them at Gong, preventing them from going west.

sentences.zh: 是時，彭越渡河擊楚東阿，殺楚將軍薛公。
項王乃自東擊彭越。
漢王得淮陰侯兵，欲渡河南。
鄭忠說漢王，乃止壁河內。
使劉賈將兵佐彭越，燒楚積聚。
項王東擊破之，走彭越。
漢王則引兵渡河，復取成皋，軍廣武，就敖倉食。
項王已定東海來，西，與漢俱臨廣武而軍，相守數月。

translations.literal: At this time, Peng Yue crossed the river and struck Chu at Dong'e, killing Chu general Xue Gong. King Xiang then personally went east to strike Peng Yue. Han King got Marquis Huaiyin's troops and wished to cross south of the river. Zheng Zhong advised Han King, and he then stopped and fortified Henan. He sent Liu Jia to lead troops and assist Peng Yue, burning Chu's stored supplies. King Xiang went east and struck and defeated them, making Peng Yue flee. Han King then led his troops across the river, again took Chenggao, stationed his army at Guangwu, and approached the Ao granary for food. King Xiang, having already pacified Donghai, came west. With Han they both faced Guangwu and stationed their armies, mutually defending for several months.

sentences.zh: 當此時，彭越數反梁地，絕楚糧食，項王患之。
為高俎，置太公其上，告漢王曰：「今不急下，吾烹太公。」
漢王曰：「吾與項羽俱北面受命懷王，曰『約為兄弟』，吾翁即若翁，必欲烹而翁，則幸分我一桮羹。」
項王怒，欲殺之。
項伯曰：「天下事未可知，且為天下者不顧家，雖殺之無益，只益禍耳。」
項王從之。

translations.literal: At this time, Peng Yue several times rebelled in Liang territory, cutting off Chu's grain and food. King Xiang was worried by it. He made a high chopping block and placed Tai Gong on it. He told Han King: 'If you do not quickly surrender now, I will boil Tai Gong.' Han King said: 'Xiang Yu and I both faced north and received commands from King Huai, agreeing to be brothers. My father is your father. If you must boil your father, then luckily divide me one cup of the broth.' King Xiang was angered and wished to kill him. Xiang Bo said: 'World affairs are not yet knowable. Moreover, one who contends for the world does not consider family. Though you kill him, it is not beneficial. It only increases calamity.' King Xiang followed it.

sentences.zh: 楚漢久相持未決，丁壯苦軍旅，老弱罷轉漕。
項王謂漢王曰：「天下匈匈數歲者，徒以吾兩人耳，願與漢王挑戰決雌雄，毋徒苦天下之民父子為也。」
漢王笑謝曰：「吾寧鬬智，不能鬬力。」
項王令壯士出挑戰。
漢有善騎射者樓煩，楚挑戰三合，樓煩輒射殺之。
項王大怒，乃自被甲持戟挑戰。
樓煩欲射之，項王瞋目叱之，樓煩目不敢視，手不敢發，遂走還入壁，不敢復出。
漢王使人閒問之，乃項王也。
漢王大驚。
於是項王乃即漢王相與臨廣武閒而語。
漢王數之，項王怒，欲一戰。
漢王不聽，項王伏弩射中漢王。
漢王傷，走入成皋。

translations.literal: Chu and Han had long confronted each other with no decision. Young men suffered from military service. The old and weak were exhausted from transporting grain. King Xiang said to Han King: 'The world has been in turmoil for several years, only because of us two. I wish to challenge Han King to decide the victor. Do not vainly make the world's people and their fathers and sons suffer.' Han King smiled and declined, saying: 'I would rather fight with wits, I cannot fight with strength.' King Xiang ordered brave warriors to go out and challenge. Han had a skilled horse archer named Lou Fan. Chu challenged three rounds. Lou Fan each time shot and killed them. King Xiang was greatly angered. He then personally donned armor, held a halberd, and challenged. Lou Fan wished to shoot him. King Xiang glared with his eyes and berated him. Lou Fan's eyes did not dare look, his hand did not dare release. He then fled back and entered the fortifications, not daring to come out again. Han King sent people to secretly ask him. It was King Xiang. Han King was greatly shocked. Therefore King Xiang then approached Han King and they mutually faced each other between Guangwu and spoke. Han King berated him. King Xiang was angered and wished for one battle. Han King did not listen. King Xiang hid and shot Han King with a crossbow. Han King was wounded and fled into Chenggao.

sentences.zh: 項王聞淮陰侯已舉河北，破齊、趙，且欲擊楚，乃使龍且往擊之。
淮陰侯與戰，騎將灌嬰擊之，大破楚軍，殺龍且。
韓信因自立為齊王。
項王聞龍且軍破，則恐，使盱臺人武涉往說淮陰侯。
淮陰侯弗聽。
是時，彭越復反，下梁地，絕楚糧。
項王乃謂海春侯大司馬曹咎等曰：「謹守成皋，則漢欲挑戰，慎勿與戰，毋令得東而已。
我十五日必誅彭越，定梁地，復從將軍。」
乃東，行擊陳留、外黃。

translations.literal: King Xiang heard that Marquis Huaiyin had already raised Hebei, broken Qi and Zhao, and moreover wished to strike Chu. He then sent Long Ju to go strike him. Marquis Huaiyin fought with him. Cavalry general Guan Ying struck him. They greatly defeated the Chu army and killed Long Ju. Han Xin took advantage to self-establish as Qi King. King Xiang heard that Long Ju's army was defeated and then feared. He sent the Xutai man Wu She to go persuade Marquis Huaiyin. Marquis Huaiyin did not listen. At this time, Peng Yue again rebelled, took Liang territory, and cut off Chu's grain. King Xiang then said to Lord Haichun, Grand Marshal Cao Jiu, and others: 'Carefully defend Chenggao. If Han wishes to challenge, carefully do not battle with them. Only do not let them get east.' I will certainly execute Peng Yue in fifteen days, pacify Liang territory, and again follow the generals.' He then went east and en route struck Chenliu and Waihuang.

sentences.zh: 外黃不下。
數日，已降，項王怒，悉令男子年十五已上詣城東，欲阬之。
外黃令舍人兒年十三，往說項王曰：「彭越彊劫外黃，外黃恐，故且降，待大王。
大王至，又皆阬之，百姓豈有歸心？
從此以東，梁地十餘城皆恐，莫肯下矣。」
項王然其言，乃赦外黃當阬者。
東至睢陽，聞之皆爭下項王。

translations.literal: Waihuang did not submit. After several days, they already surrendered. King Xiang was angered. He ordered all males fifteen years and above to go east of the city, wishing to bury them alive. Waihuang magistrate's retainer, a boy of thirteen, went and persuaded King Xiang, saying: 'Peng Yue forcibly coerced Waihuang. Waihuang feared, therefore temporarily surrendered, waiting for the great king. The great king arrives, and moreover buries them all alive. How will the common people have hearts of allegiance? East from this, all ten more cities in Liang territory will fear. None will be willing to submit.' King Xiang approved his words and then pardoned those in Waihuang who should have been buried alive. Going east to Suiyang, when they heard it, all competed to submit to King Xiang.

sentences.zh: 漢果數挑楚軍戰，楚軍不出。
使人辱之，五六日，大司馬怒，渡兵汜水。
士卒半渡，漢擊之，大破楚軍，盡得楚國貨賂。
大司馬咎、長史翳、塞王欣皆自剄汜水上。
大司馬咎者，故蘄獄掾，長史欣亦故櫟陽獄吏，兩人嘗有德於項梁，是以項王信任之。
當是時，項王在睢陽，聞海春侯軍敗，則引兵還。
漢軍方圍鐘離眛於滎陽東，項王至，漢軍畏楚，盡走險阻。

translations.literal: Han indeed several times provoked the Chu army to battle. The Chu army did not come out. They sent people to insult them. After five or six days, the grand marshal was angered and crossed his troops over the Si River. The soldiers were half crossed when Han struck them. They greatly defeated the Chu army and completely got Chu's state goods and valuables. Grand Marshal Cao Jiu, Chief Clerk Dong Yi, and King Sai Sima Xin all cut their own throats on the Si River. Grand Marshal Cao Jiu had formerly been a Qi prison clerk. Chief Clerk Sima Xin had also formerly been a Queyang prison official. The two had once shown virtue to Xiang Liang, which is why King Xiang trusted them. At this time, King Xiang was at Suiyang. He heard that Lord Haichun's army was defeated and then led his troops back. The Han army was just surrounding Zhongli Mo east of Xingyang. King Xiang arrived. The Han army feared Chu and all fled to dangerous places.

sentences.zh: 是時，漢兵盛食多，項王兵罷食絕。
漢遣陸賈說項王，請太公，項王弗聽。
漢王復使侯公往說項王，項王乃與漢約，中分天下，割鴻溝以西者為漢，鴻溝而東者為楚。
項王許之，即歸漢王父母妻子。
軍皆呼萬歲。
漢王乃封侯公為平國君。
匿弗肯復見。
曰：「此天下辯士，所居傾國，故號為平國君。」
項王已約，乃引兵解而東歸。

translations.literal: At this time, Han's troops were flourishing and had plentiful food. King Xiang's troops were exhausted and their food was cut off. Han sent Lu Jia to persuade King Xiang and request Tai Gong. King Xiang did not listen. Han King again sent Marquis Hou Gong to go persuade King Xiang. King Xiang then agreed with Han to divide the world in the middle, with Honggou west going to Han and Honggou east going to Chu. King Xiang permitted it and immediately returned Han King's parents, wives, and children. The army all called 'ten thousand years.' Han King then enfeoffed Marquis Hou Gong as Lord Pingguo. He hid and was not willing to be seen again. He said: 'This is a world-class eloquent scholar. Wherever he resides, he overthrows the state. Therefore he is titled Lord Pingguo.' King Xiang had already agreed. He then led his troops to withdraw and return east.

sentences.zh: 漢欲西歸，張良、陳平說曰：「漢有天下太半，而諸侯皆附之。
楚兵罷食盡，此天亡楚之時也，不如因其機而遂取之。
今釋弗擊，此所謂『養虎自遺患』也。」
漢王聽之。
漢五年，漢王乃追項王至陽夏南，止軍，與淮陰侯韓信、建成侯彭越期會而擊楚軍。
至固陵，而信、越之兵不會。
楚擊漢軍，大破之。
漢王復入壁，深塹而自守。
謂張子房曰：「諸侯不從約，為之柰何？」
對曰：「楚兵且破，信、越未有分地，其不至固宜。
君王能與共分天下，今可立致也。
即不能，事未可知也。
君王能自陳以東傅海，盡與韓信；
睢陽以北至穀城，以與彭越：使各自為戰，則楚易敗也。」
漢王曰：「善。」
於是乃發使者告韓信、彭越曰：「并力擊楚。
楚破，自陳以東傅海與齊王，睢陽以北至穀城與彭相國。」
使者至，韓信、彭越皆報曰：「請今進兵。」
韓信乃從齊往，劉賈軍從壽春并行，屠城父，至垓下。
大司馬周殷叛楚，以舒屠六，舉九江兵，隨劉賈、彭越皆會垓下，詣項王。

translations.literal: Han wished to return west. Zhang Liang and Chen Ping advised, saying: 'Han has more than half the world, and all the feudal lords attach to it. Chu's troops are exhausted and food is exhausted. This is heaven's time to destroy Chu. It is better to take advantage of this opportunity and then take it. Now to release and not strike—this is what is called 'raising a tiger that leaves calamity for oneself.' Han King listened to it. In Han's fifth year, Han King then pursued King Xiang to south of Yangxia. He stopped his army and agreed to meet with Marquis Huaiyin Han Xin and Marquis Jiancheng Peng Yue to strike the Chu army. They arrived at Guling, but Xin and Yue's troops did not assemble. Chu struck the Han army and greatly defeated it. Han King again entered the fortifications, dug deep moats, and defended himself. He said to Zhang Zifang: 'The feudal lords do not follow the agreement. What should I do?' He replied: 'Chu's troops are about to be broken. Xin and Yue do not yet have divided lands. Their not coming is certainly appropriate. If the lord king is able to share and divide the world with them, it can be achieved immediately now. If not able, matters are not yet knowable. If the lord king is able to give from Chen east reaching the sea, completely to Han Xin; From Suiyang north to Gucheng, to give to Peng Yue: make each fight for themselves, then Chu will be easy to defeat.' Han King said: 'Good.' Therefore he then sent envoys to tell Han Xin and Peng Yue: 'Combine your strength to strike Chu. When Chu is broken, from Chen east reaching the sea to give to the Qi King, from Suiyang north to Gucheng to give to Chancellor Peng.' The envoys arrived.
